case_law.court: Supreme Court of the United States
case_law.holding: Separate educational facilities are inherently unequal and violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.
case_law.facts: African American students were denied admission to public schools attended by white children under laws requiring racial segregation.
case_law.legal_reasoning: The Court found that segregation in public education creates a feeling of inferiority that affects children's motivation to learn and deprives them of equal educational opportunities.
case_law.binding_authority: Supreme Court precedent binding on all lower courts
case_law.full_text: We conclude that, in the field of public education, the doctrine of 'separate but equal' has no place...

case_law.court: Supreme Court of the United States
case_law.holding: Criminal suspects must be informed of their rights before interrogation, including the right to remain silent and right to counsel.
case_law.facts: Defendant was interrogated without being informed of his constitutional rights and made incriminating statements.
case_law.legal_reasoning: The Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination requires that suspects be warned of their rights to ensure voluntary waiver.
case_law.binding_authority: Supreme Court precedent binding on all lower courts
case_law.full_text: Prior to any questioning, the person must be warned that he has a right to remain silent...

case_law.court: Supreme Court of the United States
case_law.holding: The Constitution protects a woman's right to choose whether to continue a pregnancy, but this right is not absolute.
case_law.facts: Texas law prohibited abortions except to save the mother's life, challenged as unconstitutional.
case_law.legal_reasoning: The Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment provides a fundamental right to privacy that protects personal reproductive decisions.

case_law.full_text: This right of privacy, whether it be founded in the Fourteenth Amendment's concept of personal liberty...

case_law.court: Supreme Court of the United States
case_law.holding: The Supreme Court has the authority to review acts of Congress and declare them unconstitutional.
case_law.facts: William Marbury sought a writ of mandamus to compel delivery of his judicial commission.
case_law.legal_reasoning: It is the duty of the judicial department to say what the law is, establishing the principle of judicial review.
case_law.binding_authority: Foundational Supreme Court precedent establishing judicial review
case_law.full_text: It is emphatically the province and duty of the judicial department to say what the law is...

case_law.court: Supreme Court of the United States
case_law.holding: States must provide counsel to criminal defendants who cannot afford an attorney in felony cases.
case_law.facts: Clarence Gideon was charged with a felony and requested court-appointed counsel but was denied.
case_law.legal_reasoning: The Sixth Amendment's guarantee of counsel is fundamental to a fair trial and applies to state courts through the Fourteenth Amendment.
case_law.binding_authority: Supreme Court precedent binding on all courts
case_law.full_text: The right of one charged with crime to counsel may not be deemed fundamental and essential to fair trials...
